This game can be quite fun, however the fact remains that it is very survivor-tailored. Being a killer is like trying to open the worlds toughest pickle jar with your toes. This new ranking system makes pipping incredibly hard for killers as it really hurts you in ways you really can't control. In fact it seems to reward you for camping a survivor which is not fun for either party. It is also worth noting that bugs are incredibly common, and rarely fixed. When they are they've been in the game for quite awhile. I rather like this game, but it's honestly not worth the time nor the money I invested in it. It's rather sad.

Joke.This game is a goddamn joke. From blood point gain, to ranking system, to perks, to items and add-ons. 

DISCLAIMER: I don't think killers or survivors owe me anything, regardless of how i personally play. I am making statements from personal experiences, and observations. While mentionning issues brought to me by other players from ranks 1 to 20.

Gameplay.
Progression system (perks and ranking system).
Unlockables.

Let's start with the [b]gameplay[b] for both survivor and killer individually, then a little combined rant.

[b]Survivor[b] side. Oh, you're unlucky and the killer found you within 10 seconds of the game, OH LOOK! killer has shitty internet/ping and randomly catches you even though he/she wasn't even close? Got you downed and hooked within another 10 seconds? and no other survivor wants to help OR (my favorite) the killer camps you? Well you'll get 100-300 points. (without struggle) With struggle you'll still get less than 1k. That's just enough to go **** yourself with. [b](why are points important? skip to bloodweb and ranking section)[b] Granted you may not be as unlucky as me with that, but considering the amount of times i have watched other survivors rage quit from this, it is worth mentioning.

[b]Killer[b] high level or low level killer, same as survivor, you get a player who's internet does all the work for them, that player can run away from you in a goddamn straight line. Not to mention the cheap players who abuse pallet looping, or the ones who are so good at the game, they don't go for generators, they go for THE KILLER's to blind them, troll them, constantly looking for an opportunity to mess with the killer, not to win, but to piss the killer off. They'll do 0 gens, make you chase them, pallet loop you, then chase you when you got for another survivor just to try and pallet you and to blind you.

The problem with both of these for gameplay, is the fact that with the right loadout / group of friends this game can be insanely unfair for both survivor and killer. Which is why that EVEN IN THE LOADING SCREEN you see so many players/killers leave before the game even starts. Killers will dodge groups of friends, survivors will dodge killers with horrible ping. Hell, the amount of quitters i see when the exit gates spawn right next to each other and the killer just camps it is just laughable. The quality of gameplay for either side is highly influenced by each players internet, and the generation of the map. You'll get a map where there's nothing to keep you alive or to let you get away from the killer no matter how well you play, or there will be so many pallets/barriers that the killer will spend almost half the match chasing 1 survivor.

[b]Progression System[b]

[b]Survivor/killer progression[b] makes no sense. *Let's make unlockable items, perks AND freaking add-ons to those items cost 3000+ points EACH while making bloodpoint gain a ****ing trainwreck. At later levels you need 100 000+ blood points to move on to the next bloodweb (not counting the entity). Best part? Think you can use the cool item you just unlocked on another character?? THINK AGAIN every item/add-on/perk you get is survivor/killer specific. So not only do you need to spend HOURS upon HOURS of ****ing grinding to get perks/items you need, you gotta do it MULTIPLE TIMES. Not only are some of the most used perks in the game CHARACTER SPECIFIC they are LEVEL specific to teach them too! You are forced to grind that character to a retarded level of 30+ to be able to have those perks on other characters. You want balanced landing? Better spend 10+ hours getting that nea up to 30. you want self care to boot? spend another 10+ hours getting that claudette to 40. You want the tinkerer perk? Better get used to handling that chainsaw, cause the billy holds that one at 40. 

[b]Level up system / perks[b] for survivor/killer. by level 10 you can have 5 different abilities or more unlocked, but only 1 slot to use 1 ability, and unlocked other ability slots at 15 20 and 25. WHY?!??? You should have all slots available from level 1! NOT ONLY are we forced to get abilities THAT WE DON'T EVEN WANT, there's 3 different ranks to them? WHA THE FUC-WHY?!?!? There's little to no change to these abilities per ranks, not to mention that 60-70% of abilities FOR SURVIVORS are absolutely useless. Killers are at 40-50% for useless perks. So not only are you forced to spend bloodpoints on abilities that you don't want, hell on abilities that may be completely useless, you gotta buy them multiple times to have full efficiency. If you are lucky, yeah you can get a shrine that may have 1 or 2 good perks to teach right away, but shard grind is even more tedious than bloodpoint grinding. 

[b]Ranking system[b] (to be updated)

[b]Unlockables[b]
I'll keep this one short.

You spent a couple thousand bloodpoints on items that you have a high risk of losing. Whether it be from dying, from overuse, or (i cant believe this is a thing) the perk Franklin's Demise. Which makes a survivor drop their item if they are hit by the killer. Not to mention, once again, plenty of items/addons they do absolutely nothing for both killer and survivor. here's the best part. You can't just get the item you want, you gotta spend bloodpoints on crappy stuff thats in the way because you are forcedto follow a path to said item. If you unlock an ultra rare offering and you use it, the killer quits at the very start because you used said offering, you lose it. there goes 7000 bloodpoints for no reason.

I played this game over 2 years ago, back when there was only 3 killers. I quit because shit was too stupid. I decided to reinstall to play with some friends, and im honestly surprised theres still so many things wrong with it. I'm not surprised this game died so quickly after release.

UPDATE ON NEW RANKING SYSTEM. ooooohhh my god. This game is even more trash now than it was before. You have 4 categories (Emblems) in which to score points to pip for both killer and survivor. You can score from nothing to Bronze, Silver, Gold & Iridescent. This is not a bad idea, IF the scoring system wasn't complete garbage. Each Emblem rank gave 1 bar. for a max of 4 each emblem for a total 16. 6 to safety pip, 9 to pip, and 14 to double pip.
SURVIVOR:
Lightbringer scores you based on your participation of getting Generators, Hex Totems, and opening Exit gates. Doesn't sound bad right? Let's take a look! To get the best rank in this categories you need 310 points. 1 Generator can give you 100. BUT if you have someone helping you from start to finish, you only get 50 points. you get 1 point per % you have fixed. So, 5 Generators, 500 points total. Hex Totems are worth 50 and exit gates worth 15. So, unless you've planning on popping 3 jennyâ€™s yourself, you will rarely get top marks in this categorie. To even this out, I believe hex totems should be worth at-least 75, and dull totems worth 25. Maybe even bump the exit gate up to 30. A good match, when you do 2 jennys by yourself, open an exit gate and you still donâ€™t max out? 200 for gens, 15 for gate, 25 for all completed gens, 240 points? You could find a last-minute totem and STILL not get top marks. Not to mention when the game bugs and doesnâ€™t give you your points anyway. I have had a match where the killer camped every survivor. I did 4 jennyâ€™s myself and opened an exit gate. thatâ€™s 400 for gens, 15 for gate and another 25 for gens completed, and i have gotten gold tier.

I am skipping the next one because i believe it is the same as the last one and will be talking about both at the same time.

3rd Emblem if Benevolent. (saving or healing others) 

Now to get top marks in this, you need 100 points. Sounds more reasonable than the last one right? You start with 20 points, but if a survivor is hooked, you lose points. "The first two times each Survivor is hooked, all Survivors lose points." Fucking what??? You're telling me, that when I or another player gets hooked...

I formally had a review stating that I would NOT recommend this game to a friend due to their inability to balance the pipping system. But they have sinced changed it again, and I feel like it has become more balanced when it comes to pipping. They changed the numbers, making it more realistic for survivors to pip. However, I do feel as though the pallets need a bit more work, as they feel very wonky, and clunky to use. Its not that pallets are bad now like some say, it's just going to force you to not take that one extra loop that you're use to taking. Once you adjust to the pallet change, it feels more balanced, in terms of chases than the vacuum. I DO feel, however that the Clown needs a bit of a nerf when it comes to his movement speed. He has a slowing potion, yet he is still normal speed. It makes it almost impossible to get away from him if he is accurate with his bottles. Just my opinion, though. :) Glad to see some positive changes for once. :)
